citation.article-title: Nevskia soli sp. nov., isolated from soil cultivated with Korean ginseng.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Nevskia soli sp. nov.
Nevskia soli (so′li. L. neut. gen. n. soli of soil, the source of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, motile, non-spore-forming and rod-shaped (0.5×1.5–2.0 μm).
Colonies are white, circular and convex with clear margins after 4 days on R2A medium.
Growth occurs at 15–30 °C (optimum 25–28 °C) and pH 4.0–7.0 (optimum pH 6.0–7.0).
Grows in the absence of NaCl, but does not grow on 2 % NaCl.
Hydrolysis of casein, chitin, CM-cellulose, DNA, pectin and tyrosine is not observed.
Predominant cellular fatty acids (>10 %) are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and summed feature 2 (C14 : 0 3-OH and/or iso-C16 : 1 I).
DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63.9 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, GR15-1T (=KACC 11703T =DSM 19509T), was isolated from soil cultivated with Korean ginseng in the Yeongju region of Korea.
